page.title: 17ENTERTAINMENT SHILLINGSTONE
page.content: Like many villages in the area,most of the entertainment in this part of the Blackmore Vale is "homegrown".Several occasions have now become traditional.In Shillingstone the annual concert produced by Myra Whiting for the Scool Action Committee is always hilarious,and has grown from one night to three nights and a matinee each year because of the demand for tickets.The Annual Raft Race organised by the Seymour Arms attracts entries fromm a wide area of Dorset. Rafts race down the Stour from Shillingstone to Blandford,a journey which takes from 2 to 6 hours.The Primary school holds an Annual Country Dance party which includes Maypole Dances. This is well supported by the village as well as parents, relatives and former pupils.
